title: Perfectly competitive labor market in Bazra

content.description:
The labor market in the town of Bazra is perfectly competitive, and 10 percent of the labor force is employed in the clothing industry.

Assume that the clothing manufacturers close their plants in Bazra. Using a correctly labeled supply and demand graph, predict the impact that closing these plants will have on each of the following.

The wage rate and number of workers employed in Bazra

The number of workers in Bazra looking for work who cannot find employment at the wage rate you identified in (i)

After the clothing manufacturers closed their plants in Bazra, the town passes a law that establishes an effective minimum wage. What impact will this minimum wage have on each of the following?

The wage rate and number of workers employed in Bazra

The number of workers in Bazra looking for work who cannot find employment

Assume that the minimum wage remains in effect and there is an increase in the demand for goods produced in Bazra. What happens to employment in Bazra? Explain why.
